title: Artificial Intelligence (AI) Intern
description:
Summary: 
Diné Development Corporation is a Navajo Nation owned family of companies that delivers IT, professional, and environmental solutions. As an Artificial Intelligence (AI) Intern, you will work closely with data scientists and engineers to develop, test, and deploy AI models and tools, gaining hands-on experience in a collaborative environment.

Responsibilities: 
Assist in the development and training of machine learning and deep learning models.
Conduct data preprocessing, cleaning, and exploratory data analysis (EDA).
Contribute to the implementation and fine-tuning of natural language processing (NLP), computer vision, or recommendation system pipelines.
Perform literature reviews and prototype algorithms based on recent AI research papers.
Help evaluate model performance using standard metrics and suggest improvements.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate AI components into products or services.
Document findings, experiments, and code in a clear and reproducible format.
Other duties as assigned.

Qualification: 
Required
  -Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Statistics, or a related field.
  -Familiarity with Python and relevant AI/ML libraries (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow, Scikit-learn, Hugging Face).
  -Understanding of fundamental concepts in machine learning, neural networks, and statistics.
  -Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
  -Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
  -US citizen able to pass a standard background.

Preferred
  -Experience with large language models (LLMs), transformers, or generative AI.
  -Knowledge of MLOps or model deployment practices.
  -Participation in AI-related research, competitions (e.g., Kaggle), or personal projects.

title: Data Engineer Intern
description:
Summary: 
Wurl is a company focused on creating innovative technologies for the streaming industry. They are seeking a Data Engineering Intern to support performance marketing initiatives on Connected TV, offering hands-on experience in building data-driven solutions for ad targeting and campaign optimization.

Responsibilities: 
Collaborate with the Data Engineering team to develop and maintain scalable data pipelines that support performance marketing efforts on CTV.
Assist in implementing attribution models that tie CTV viewership to campaigns.
Work with cross-functional teams to integrate AI-driven targeting into our data infrastructure.
Analyze viewer engagement data to identify opportunities for optimizing return on ad spend (ROAS).
Contribute to the development of tools and dashboards that provide insights into campaign performance and audience behavior.

Qualification: 
Required
  -Pursuing or recently completed a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related technical field.
  -Proficiency in Python and SQL.
  -Familiarity with data engineering concepts and tools (e.g., ETL processes, data warehousing).
  -Interest in digital advertising, performance marketing, and streaming media technologies.
  -Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  -Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.

Preferred
  -Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS) and big data technologies.
  -Understanding of ad tech ecosystems and metrics (e.g., CPM, CTR, ROAS).
  -Exposure to AI/ML concepts, particularly in the context of ad targeting and personalization.
  -DataBricks experience.
  -Familiarity with interactive ad formats and their implementation.

title: Artificial Intelligence (AI) Intern
description:
Summary: 
NOVA-Diné is committed to pushing the boundaries of innovation through cutting-edge technology, and they are seeking a motivated and curious AI Intern to support their ongoing projects and R&D efforts. The intern will work closely with data scientists, engineers, and product teams to develop, test, and deploy AI models and tools in a collaborative environment.

Responsibilities: 
Assist in the development and training of machine learning and deep learning models.
Conduct data preprocessing, cleaning, and exploratory data analysis (EDA).
Contribute to the implementation and fine-tuning of natural language processing (NLP), computer vision, or recommendation system pipelines.
Perform literature reviews and prototype algorithms based on recent AI research papers.
Help evaluate model performance using standard metrics and suggest improvements.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate AI components into products or services.
Document findings, experiments, and code in a clear and reproducible format.
Other duties as assigned.

Qualification: 
Required
  -Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Statistics, or a related field.
  -Familiarity with Python and relevant AI/ML libraries (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow, Scikit-learn, Hugging Face).
  -Understanding of fundamental concepts in machine learning, neural networks, and statistics.
  -Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
  -Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
  -US citizen able to pass a standard background.

Preferred
  -Exposure to cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, or Azure) is a plus.
  -Experience with large language models (LLMs), transformers, or generative AI.
  -Knowledge of MLOps or model deployment practices.
  -Participation in AI-related research, competitions (e.g., Kaggle), or personal projects.

title: 2025 Fall Intern - Automation & Systems Optimization
description:
Summary: 
Frontier Airlines offers group and charter, and cargo transportation services. The intern will focus on building and implementing automation and AI-driven solutions within the Inflight Experience department, evaluating existing processes and developing internal apps to enhance operational efficiency.

Responsibilities: 
Evaluate current inflight workflows and identify automation opportunities (25%)
Develop internal applications or tools that integrate with existing platforms like SharePoint and Power BI (20%)
Collaborate with inflight leaders to ensure new systems meet operational needs and improve efficiency (15%)
Test, launch, and refine automated solutions to ensure they are effective and user-friendly (15%)
Monitor the impact of automation on key performance metrics and adjust strategies as needed (10%)
Research and recommend future technologies that could further streamline inflight
Support the development of user guides or training materials for new tools

Qualification: 
Required
  -Currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or related technical field
  -Strong programming skills (Python, JavaScript, etc.)
  -Ability to design and implement technology solutions from concept to deployment
  -Analytical mindset with a passion for problem-solving and innovation
  -Excellent communication skills to collaborate with technical and non-technical stakeholders
  -Self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced environment and can deliver results quickly

Preferred
  -Experience with coding, automation tools, and AI technologies

title: Firmware Engineering Intern - Temporary
description:
Summary: 
Natus Medical Incorporated is a company that offers medical equipment and solutions for diagnosing and treating disorders of the brain and sensory nervous systems. They are seeking a Firmware Engineering Intern to simulate digital filters, design algorithms, and develop embedded software systems to support their innovative medical products.

Responsibilities: 
Simulate digital filters and signal processing algorithms in MATLAB.
Design, implement and optimize algorithms in C/C++.
Develop and implement embedded software systems on HW targets like NXP processor 1064, 1170 or other NXP i.MX RT crossover MCU, supported by the MCUXpresso IDE and IAR Embedded workbench for ARM IDE.
Create unit tests for software components to evaluate the performance in assist to the processor selection.
Learn and understand output and input data paths and data buffering of hearing screening devices, including ADC/DAC on a HW platform.
Learn sampling rate conversion and screening signal processing algorithms.

Qualification: 
Required
  -Programming skills in C, C++ and script languages such as MATLAB and python
  -Software skills in data structures, algorithms and design patterns
  -Hands-on experience with IDE development environment
  -Strong Math background
  -Fundamentals of digital signal processing
  -Familiar with RTOS, Windows, Android based applications

title: Data Governance Internship
description:
Summary: 
Spencer's & Spirit Halloween is a leading specialty retailer offering a rewarding internship program. As a Data Governance Analyst Intern, you will support data enablement by standardizing data processes and improving the usability of governance tools and systems.

Responsibilities: 
Create visual reports and executive-ready dashboards to highlight data quality trends and governance progress
Document data workflows, definitions, and standards to improve system usability and promote consistency
Contribute to internal communications and training materials to boost enterprise awareness of data practices
Support cross-functional collaboration to increase business engagement in data governance beyond analyst roles
Help develop and maintain business glossaries and reference materials for greater data transparency

Qualification: 
Required
  -A solid grasp of fundamental data concepts, including data types, data quality, data lifecycle, data governance principles, is recommended
  -Proficiency in data literacy, interpretation, and problem-solving is essential to comprehend complex data structures, identify patterns, and derive insights from data
  -Foundational knowledge of database relationships, Excel, SharePoint, and MS applications

title: Data Science Intern
description:
Summary: 
Ezzy Manufacturing is redefining commercial interiors with innovative flooring and lighting solutions. They are seeking a Data Science Intern to support data-driven decision-making and business intelligence initiatives, working closely with various teams to analyze performance metrics and optimize workflows.

Responsibilities: 
Extract, clean, and analyze large datasets to generate actionable insights for large scale project performance.
Develop SQL queries to retrieve and manage structured data from internal databases.
Design dashboards and reports using Power BI, Tableau, or Google Data Studio to track key business and project metrics.
Work with project managers and finance teams to analyze budget trends, estimates, material costs, and operational efficiency.
Support demand forecasting and resource planning through data modeling.
Automate data reporting processes to improve efficiency and reduce manual work.
Perform market trend analysis and risk assessments based on historical project data.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate business needs into analytical solutions.
Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and compliance with company standards.

Qualification: 
Required
  -Currently pursuing or recently completed a Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics, Marketing Analytics or a related field.
  -Proficiency in SQL for querying and managing large datasets.
  -Strong experience with Power BI, Tableau, or Google Data Studio for data visualization.
  -Knowledge of data modeling, ETL processes, and database management.
  -Ability to interpret manufacturing-related data and provide actionable business insights.
  -Strong problem-solving, analytical thinking, and attention to detail.
  -Ability to work independently and collaborate with multiple teams.

Preferred
  -Experience with Python or R for statistical analysis

title: Software Engineering Co-op_Fall 2025
description:
Summary: 
GE Appliances, a Haier company, is a leading U.S. appliance company seeking a Software Engineering Co-op for Fall 2025. The role offers hands-on experience in various technical assignments while working with a mentor to support business goals and enhance professional development.

Responsibilities: 
Work with your mentor to accomplish established goals that support the business and offer learning opportunity
Complete innovative, technical assignments in areas such as New Product Introduction, Product Improvement, Modeling and Simulation, Advanced Development, Sourced Products, Software Development, or GEA’s own Micro-Factory, FirstBuild!
Attend development and training sessions to enhance your technical knowledge and professional enhancement
Take part in networking and community volunteer projects
Optional events will be available both in and out of work. These include lunches, weekend activities, sports, and cookouts.

Qualification: 
Required
  -Currently enrolled in an accredited university pursuing a bachelor's degree or higher in Engineering (Computer, or Software Engineering)
  -May 2026 or later graduation date
  -Cumulative GPA >=3.0 (out of 4.0)
  -Legal authorization to work in the country/region where the business is hiring is required. We will not sponsor individuals for employment visas now, nor in the future, for this position.

Preferred
  -Ability to have two or more co-op rotations before graduation
  -Related coursework
  -Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills
  -Solid analytical skills
  -Desire and ability to learn
  -Passion for engineering

title: Data Analytics & AI Intern
description:
Summary: 
Sutter Health is a non-profit organization operating a network of hospitals and physicians in Northern California. They are seeking a Data Analytics & AI Intern to support the data analytics & AI team by participating in various projects and initiatives while conducting research and reporting.

Responsibilities: 
Provides services to the day-to-day operating objectives of data analytics & AI team at an acute care hospital, medical group/foundation and ambulatory care environment in an integrated, not-for-profit health care system.
Participates in projects and programs appropriate to the needs of the assigned area, participating in the planning and implementation of projects and initiatives, conducting research and reporting including recommendations or proposals for action.

Qualification: 
Required
  -Pursuing a bachelor's degree or have graduated from an accredited university within the last year.
  -Aptitude to perform data and process analytics and formulating solutions.
  -Working knowledge of MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
  -Proven ability to build effective working relationships as well as interpersonal skills.
  -Verbal and written communication skills.
  -Ability to learn quickly and experience producing high quality work in short periods of time.

title: 2025 Fall Embedded Firmware Co-Op (Rochester, NY)
description:
Summary: 
Applied Materials is the global leader in materials engineering solutions used to produce virtually every new chip and advanced display in the world. The primary role is to design, analyze and develop embedded software for the purpose of characterizing RF power systems.

Responsibilities: 
Design, analyze and develop embedded software for the purpose of characterizing RF power systems

Qualification: 
Required
  -Student must be pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree program in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field
  -Student must be in good academic standing at their university
  -Quick learner, high degree of flexibility and problem-solving skills
  -Experience in data collection using Matlab / Python or similar tools for analysis is highly desired
  -Experience in C/C++ development required
  -Experience with embedded microprocessors required
  -Development in a real-time operating system environment

Preferred
  -Preferred GPA of 3.0 or above on a 4.0 scale
  -Experience with configuration management tools (GIT, Bitbucket) desired
  -Experience with Atlassian tools (Jira, Confluence) desired
  -Development in Linux operating system environment desired
  -Experience with ARM processor preferred

title: Data Science Internship
description:
Summary: 
Exact Sciences is the developer and manufacturer of Cologuard, a non-invasive screening test for the early detection of colorectal cancer. They are seeking a Data Science Intern to support the Data Science team in leveraging machine learning models and statistical models to develop solutions for business challenges. The intern will gain hands-on experience in data analysis, visualization, and machine learning within the biotech industry.

Responsibilities: 
Apply machine learning, deep learning, and artificial intelligence techniques.
Support data analysis tasks, including data cleaning, for projects and ad hoc requests.
Visualize information and develop reports on results of data analysis.
Participate in Agile ceremonies, contributing to iterative development and continuous improvement.
Ability to communicate complex results to technical and non-technical audiences.
Ability to work in a highly collaborative environment.
Uphold company mission and values through accountability, innovation, integrity, quality, and teamwork.
Support and comply with the company’s Quality Management System policies and procedures.
Maintain regular and reliable attendance.
Ability to act with an inclusion mindset and model these behaviors for the organization.
Ability to work on a mobile device, tablet, or in front of a computer screen and/or perform typing for approximately 80% of a typical working day.

Qualification: 
Required
  -Current student enrolled towards a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Data Science, or related field.
  -Demonstrated working knowledge in Python or R programming.
  -Demonstrated ability to perform the essential duties of the position with or without accommodation.
  -Authorization to work in the United States without sponsorship.

Preferred
  -Current student enrolled towards a Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Data Science, or related field.
  -Working knowledge of SQL.
  -Working knowledge of version control (Git).
  -Working knowledge of statistics, modeling techniques, and Natural Language Processing.
  -Working knowledge of distributed computing and big data technologies such as Spark, and cloud computing such as AWS.

title: 2025-2026 Information Technology – Information and Analytics – Intern (Previous Intern)
description:
Summary: 
Chevron Corporation is an integrated energy and technology company that believes affordable, reliable, and ever-cleaner energy is essential to achieving a more prosperous and sustainable world. They are seeking interns in Information Technology – Information and Analytics to support data-driven decision-making and advance business objectives through analytics and data management.

Responsibilities: 
Identify and frame opportunities to apply advanced analytics, modeling, and related technologies to data that provide insight and improve decision making, and automation
Identify data necessary and appropriate technology to solve business challenges
Clean data, develop models, and test models
Establish the life cycle management process for models
Provide technical mentoring in modeling and analytics technologies, the specifics of the modeling process, and general consulting skills
Identify, acquire, cleanse/prepare, store data, and develop reusable data products aligned with defined architecture patterns
Create and manage data pipelines that enable advanced analytics models, and handle data challenges and opportunities
Ensure the scalability and reliability of model deployment, and document the technical aspects of the process
Develop and share reusable tools for data engineering tasks, and leverage technical services to optimize data workflows
Consult, identify and frame opportunities to implement AI solutions that help gain insight and improve decision making and automation
Identify data, technology, and architectural design patterns to solve business challenges using analytical tools and AI design patterns and architectures
Partner with Data Scientists and Chevron IT Foundational services to implement complex algorithms and models into enterprise scale machine learning pipelines
Build machine and deep learning systems optimized for scalability and performance
Transform data science prototypes into scalable solutions in a production environment
Orchestrate and configure infrastructure that assists Data Scientists and analysts in building low latency, scalable and resilient machine learning, and optimization workloads into an enterprise software product
Run machine learning experiments and fine-tune algorithms to ensure optimal performance
Access, gather, and analyze data from source systems
Help frame the business problem by providing quantitative and qualitative data analysis (data quality, availability, etc.)
Drive insights to business problems by visualizing the data and telling a story through data (report patterns, trends, anomalies, etc.)
Participate in the end-to-end product development lifecycle as a member of agile team
Contribute to data analysis, data wrangling, data visualization, and acceptance testing
Present findings and new development to help refine backlog items
Understand the business use of data and stakeholder requirements to support strategic business objectives
Collaborate with delivery teams to provide data management direction and support for initiatives and product development
Contribute to the design of common information models
Consult on the appropriate data integration patterns, data modeling and data quality
Maintain and share knowledge of requirements, key data types and data definitions, data stores, and data creation process

Qualification: 
Required
  -Must provide a current, unofficial transcript with online resume (as proof of good academic standing) when applying for this position to be considered.
  -Data acquisition, analysis, modeling, movement, transformation, and preparation experience
  -Demonstrated depth in advanced analytics / data science technologies (e.g., machine learning, operations research, statistics, data mining)
  -Data Analyst: Experience with data modeling, data management, data quality, SQL
  -Data Engineer: Experience using data pipelines, Data Lake and storage configuration, Python, RDBMS & SQL
  -Machine Learning Engineer: Software Engineering background. Working knowledge of mathematics (primarily linear algebra, probability, statistics), and algorithms. Working knowledge of machine learning frameworks and machine learning libraries.

Preferred
  -Currently enrolled in bachelor’s or master’s degree program in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research, Data Science, Management Information Systems, or related Engineering degree
  -Ability to communicate in a clear and concise manner both orally and in writing.
  -Knowledge of enterprise SaaS complexities including security/access control, scalability, high availability, concurrency, online diagnoses, deployment, upgrade/migration, internationalization, and production support
  -Experience designing custom APIs for machine learning models for training and inference processes.
  -Software engineering skills and fundamentals: coding (Python, R) and Github, source control versioning, requirement spec, architecture, and design review, testing methodologies, CI/CD, etc.

title: Intern Technical - Helix Center for AI and Applied Robotics
description:
Summary: 
Connection Inc. is a Global IT Solutions Provider that connects people with technology to enhance growth and innovation. The Intern Technical role at the Helix Center focuses on supporting AI and robotics workshops, executing proof of concepts, managing lab environments, and engaging with clients to facilitate projects and marketing efforts.

Responsibilities: 
Assist Helix team in preparing and delivering AI/Robotics workshops—build slide decks, hands on labs (e.g., Copilot Studio, Azure OpenAI, Fabric), and live demos.
Help ingest sample datasets, train/test simple ML models (using Python, PyTorch/TensorFlow), and deploy lightweight agent prototypes.
Configure and maintain Helix’s isolated lab environments (Azure subscriptions, on prem racks, Kubernetes clusters), document setup scripts, and validate security/compliance controls.
Clean and analyze customer or demo data; build interactive dashboards in Power BI or Python notebooks to surface insights for both internal stakeholders and clients.
Investigate emerging AI/robotics trends (e.g., RAG frameworks, edge inference, ROS2), draft one pagers or internal whitepapers, and update the Helix knowledge repository.
Attend customer calls, take detailed notes, draft recap emails and action item trackers; support creation of tailored proposals and SOW outlines.
Collaborate with Marketing on campaign collateral—case study summaries, blog posts, social media snippets—and help coordinate virtual “Helix Helps Pro” events.
Track project milestones, maintain Jira tickets for internal Helix initiatives, and coordinate cross functional handoffs between Sales, Advisory, and Engineering teams.

Qualification: 
Required
  -Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s in Computer Science, Data Science, Robotics, Engineering, or a closely related field.
  -Proficient in Python and familiar with at least one ML framework (TensorFlow, PyTorch) and data viz tools (Power BI, matplotlib).
  -Basic understanding of cloud platforms (Azure/AWS/GCP) and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes).
  -Strong written and verbal communication skills, with an ability to distill technical concepts for non technical audiences.
  -Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail, and a proactive, 'self starter' mentality.
  -Comfortable working in a fast paced, collaborator driven environment and managing multiple priorities.
  -Curious problem solver with a passion for process improvement and challenging the status quo.

Preferred
  -Familiarity with Microsoft 365 applications (Teams, SharePoint, Power Automate) is a plus.

title: Data Science Intern
description:
Summary: 
Journey Clinical is a platform that provides services to member psychotherapy practices which are independently owned and operated. They are seeking a Data Science Intern to drive key analytics initiatives that directly impact patient outcomes and business growth, including creating dashboards, analyzing user behavior, and building machine learning models.

Responsibilities: 
Analyze user data and build insights to drive business decisions
Create dashboards and reports for various teams
Develop machine learning models and automated solutions
Collaborate across teams on analytics projects

Qualification: 
Required
  -Currently pursuing or graduated from a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field
  -Strong SQL skills and experience with data analysis
  -Strong Python knowledge and machine learning knowledge
  -Experience with Tableau or similar data visualization tools
  -Good communication skills and ability to present insights to stakeholders
  -Autonomous self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced startup environment
  -Interest in healthcare, mental health, or clinical research

Preferred
  -Previous internship or project experience in healthcare analytics
  -Understanding of user behavior analytics and engagement metrics

title: 2025 Software Engineer Intern (Fall)
description:
Summary: 
Whatnot is a livestream shopping platform for buying and selling products, and they are seeking a Software Engineer Intern for Fall 2025. The role involves working in cross-functional teams to contribute to technical challenges and projects that enhance the platform.

Responsibilities: 
Building new features for users in our live-streams
Implementing growth tactics and strategies to scale our buyer and seller flows
Building systems at scale that help us deliver a high trust marketplace experience

Qualification: 
Required
  -Pursuing a degree in computer science or other related major graduating in Dec 2025 or by Summer 2026
  -Problem solver and out-of-the-box thinker
  -Willing to take risks and build product and systems for 1M+ users
  -Ability to pick up on new technologies quickly

title: Data Science Intern
description:
Summary: 
Forrester is a research and advisory firm that provides businesses with business and technology-related consulting services. They are looking for a motivated and detail-oriented Data Science Intern to support the design, development, and deployment of data-driven solutions while gaining real-world experience in applying AI and data science.

Responsibilities: 
Assist in collecting, cleaning, and analyzing large datasets.
Fully engage in all phases of the software development lifecycle (SDLC).
Support the development and evaluation of machine learning models.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to cover insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including engineering, product, and design.
Drive innovation with industry trends and best practices in AI and data science.

Qualification: 
Required
  -Hands-on experience in object-oriented design, data structures, and algorithms using modern languages, such as: Python, Java, or JavaScript.
  -Proficiency in testing/launching/maintaining solutions using ML/AI algorithms and tools, natural language processing (NLP), or large language models (LLMs).
  -Experience in developing cloud-native applications on public clouds (e.g., AWS).
  -The ability to write high-quality, efficient, and easily testable code.
  -Experience conducting software analysis, testing, and debugging code.
  -Ability to come up with smart and innovative approaches and implement newer technologies.
  -Outstanding problem-solving skills and an ability to work collaboratively within cross-functional teams.
  -Excellent communication skills to convey technical concepts effectively to diverse audiences.
  -Basic understanding of RESTful API design principles is a must.
  -Familiarity with version control systems (Git).
  -Conduct performance benchmarking across our technology stack.
  -Document optimization techniques and performance improvements.
  -Assist in developing testing methodologies to validate performance enhancements.
  -Currently pursuing or recently completed a bachelor’s or master’s degree in data science, computer science, artificial intelligence, statistics, mathematics, or a related field.
  -Strong programming skills in Python, Java, or R.
  -Familiarity with machine learning libraries such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar.
  -Experience with data manipulation tools (Pandas, NumPy) and SQL.
  -Solid understanding of statistics, linear algebra, and probability.
  -Ability to communicate technical concepts clearly and effectively.

Preferred
  -Knowledge of performance profiling tools is a plus.

title: Data & Insights Intern - Fall 2025
description:
Summary: 
International Justice Mission (IJM) is a human rights agency that secures justice for victims of slavery, sexual exploitation and other forms of violent oppression. They are seeking a Data & Insights Intern to support various initiatives within the North America regional fundraising division, focusing on developing data tools and systems to provide key insights to fundraising teams.

Responsibilities: 
Utilizing data analytics and data science tools to analyze complex, large datasets;
Support critical revenue-raising initiatives;
Supporting creation of dashboards other insight generators;
Participating in departmental and general IJM administrative support.

Qualification: 
Required
  -Bachelor's degree must be in progress for DC/Remote Internships and applicants need to have completed at least two years of undergraduate study.
  -Experience with Python, Tableau, and/or SQL.
  -Mature orthodox Christian faith.
  -Humble and resilient.
  -Pursues excellence.
  -Culturally aware and appreciative of difference.
  -Strong service ethic.
  -Innovative problem solver.
  -Ability to build trust and strong partnerships with others.
  -Courageous in pursuing opportunities and challenges.
  -Tenacious in achieving goals.
  -Professional.

title: 8 Month CV/ML Intern (Starting 2025 Aug/Sept)
description:
Summary: 
Safari AI is a seed-funded AI startup focused on automating operational data action using computer vision for leading companies. They are seeking computer vision interns to join their team for 6-12 months starting August/September 2025, with the opportunity to become full-time pending performance.

Responsibilities: 
Implementing computer vision solutions in object detection, tracking, scene segmentation, understanding, and depth estimation
Building robust solutions against camera motion and occlusions
Working with infrastructure and machine learning engineers
Defining labeling ontologies
Creating training, validation, and testing sets
Onboarding customers with machine learning solutions
Calibrating models for accuracy

Qualification: 
Required
  -Commitment to 8 months (Aug 2025 - Apr 2026)
  -Senior undergraduate or graduate students in computer science or related fields
  -Exposure to computer vision and machine learning techniques
  -Strong communication skills
  -Python expertise
  -Familiarity with deep learning frameworks (PyTorch, Tensorflow)
  -Traditional computer vision techniques
  -Experience with Linux and cloud platforms (GCP, Azure, AWS)

Preferred
  -Experience with data streaming frameworks
  -Startup environments
  -Embedded platforms
  -Java or Typescript
  -Publication records in top ML/CV conferences

title: Machine Learning Researcher
description:
Summary: 
Esync Technologies is an IT services and consulting firm dedicated to helping students and early-career professionals develop the technical and professional skills necessary for success in the tech industry. This in-person internship offers hands-on experience, mentorship, and exposure to industry professionals, focusing on developing technical skills through real-world software development projects.

Responsibilities: 
Design, develop, and test software solutions for real-world industry applications.
Collaborate with mentors and peers on projects that enhance practical skills.
Conduct research on the latest advancements in software development, AI, and IT consulting.
Participate in networking sessions, professional development workshops, and resume reviews.

Qualification: 
Required
  -Students or early-career professionals in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related fields.

title: AI/ML Engineering Intern
description:
Summary: 
Hitachi Energy is a renewable energy company that provides energy consulting services. They are seeking an AI/ML Engineering Intern to support AI initiatives within the organization, assisting in the exploration and implementation of AI technologies and contributing to ongoing projects.

Responsibilities: 
Support the development and testing of AI/ML prototypes and proof-of-concepts with technology leads.
Evaluate and benchmark new AI tools, frameworks, and vendor solutions for enterprise use.
Assist the IT AI Center of Excellence and Digital Quality Control teams in integrating AI capabilities.
Contribute to technical documentation and share findings with the innovation team.
Stay current with AI/ML advancements and propose relevant applications.

Qualification: 
Required
  -Currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related technical field.
  -Practical understanding of AI/ML concepts and hands-on experience with relevant libraries.
  -Proficient in Python.
  -Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on rapid prototyping.
  -Effective communicator and collaborative team player.
  -Proficient in English.

Preferred
  -Familiarity with other programming languages is a plus.

title: Part-Time Student - Data Analytics - Urbandale, IA
description:
Summary: 
John Deere is a manufacturing company that designs and produces lawn, garden, electric, agriculture, and construction equipment. As a Part-Time Student in Data Analytics, you will lead and support key data science projects, utilizing analytics techniques to derive actionable insights from data and collaborating with stakeholders to deliver solutions.

Responsibilities: 
Lead and/or support key data science and analytics projects for John Deere Intelligent Solutions Group
Utilize analytics techniques to clean, preprocess, explore, and analyze data sets and extract actionable insights
Collaborate in a fun, friendly, and fast-paced team environment across disciplines and with key stakeholders to deliver data-driven solutions for the business
Present your findings in meetings and translate your results into reports and presentations
Committed to working in an Agile-based environment

Qualification: 
Required
  -Experience with Python and SQL programming languages
  -School and/or work experience analyzing text and/or numerical data
  -Experience with applied statistical analysis and machine learning algorithms
  -Available to work during the academic year 16-20 hours/weekly during the business hours of 6 AM to 6 PM
  -Available to work during the summer semester 35-40 hours/weekly during the business hours of 6 AM to 6 PM
  -Must be able to commute to a John Deere Facility in either Urbandale, IA or at Ames, IA at least once a week, on a regular basis year-round
  -Pursuing a Bachelor's, Master’s, or PhD degree in an analytical discipline including but not limited to Computer Science, Data Analytics, Data Science, Engineering, Math, or Statistics
  -Must be registered as a full-time student at a U.S. accredited college/university
  -Graduation date of December 2025 or later

Preferred

  -Experience with Data Engineering and/or MLOps
  -Knowledge of Large Language Models (LLMs) and/or Artificial Intelligence (AI)

title: Software Development Co-Op - Fall 2025
description:
Summary: 
Medpace, Inc. is a clinical research organization providing clinical development services for pharmaceutical and biotechnology. They are seeking a Software Development Intern to assist with software development and validation processes, contributing to the success of the Information Technology team.

Support development managers as necessary.

Required

  -Excellent communication skills

title: Software Engineering Intern [Seattle Preferred]
description:
Summary: 
Button is a mobile commerce technology company that is powering a commerce-driven internet. They are seeking a Software Engineering Intern who will have the opportunity to learn and contribute to the full stack of their technology while collaborating with experienced engineers on real features.

Responsibilities: 
Collaborate with engineers, product managers, and designers to build user-facing features using modern web technologies like React and TypeScript.
Help maintain and improve our existing applications, APIs, and services.
Learn about backend development with technologies like Node.js, Go, and AWS.
Participate in code reviews, team meetings, and planning sessions to understand how software is built and shipped in a production environment.
Work with and learn from team members across the U.S., including close collaboration with engineers based in Seattle.
Explore areas of personal interest within our engineering stack and propose ideas or mini-projects to work on.
Get mentorship and guidance from our engineering team to grow your skills and confidence.

Qualification: 
Required
  -You’re in your final year of a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field, with a planned graduation by Spring/Summer 2025.
  -You have hands-on experience with JavaScript or TypeScript, and have built projects or contributed to applications using modern front-end or back-end technologies.
  -You’re eager to deepen your understanding of full-stack development, including how user interfaces connect with backend systems and APIs.
  -You enjoy solving complex problems, asking thoughtful questions, and collaborating with teammates to build great products.
  -You have a passion for building user-friendly interfaces and are excited to grow your skills in real-world production environments.
  -You’re self-motivated, able to manage your time well, and take ownership of your work.
  -You communicate clearly and value feedback as a tool for learning.
  -You're interested in the opportunity to convert to a full-time role after the internship based on performance and business needs.

Preferred
  -You’ve built a personal project, contributed to a class project, completed an internship, or played around with a web framework like React.
  -You’re interested in startups, ecommerce, or mobile technology.

title: AI Intern
description:

description:

title: Test Engineering Co-op- Data Science
description:

title: Graduate Intern, Operations Optimization and Support (Fall 2025)
description:

Interest in learning and applying best practices in data analysis & data science

Eagerness to learn and take initiative

description:
Summary: 
Nokia manufactures mobile devices, network infrastructure, and location-based technology for businesses. They are seeking a Firmware Development Co-op to design and implement firmware solutions, collaborate with cross-disciplinary teams, and support the transition from prototype to production.

Responsibilities: 
Design, implement, and test firmware solutions for next-generation optical engines used in Long Haul, Metro, and Data Center Interconnects.
Create and maintain documentation including FW requirements, design plans, and test procedures.
Collaborate with cross-disciplinary teams including optical, FPGA, software, and manufacturing to deliver integrated solutions.

Required

  -Solid critical thinking and troubleshooting abilities.
  -Understanding of embedded systems, especially with constraints on RAM, storage, and processing.
  -Interest in device driver and multi-threaded development for Linux and RTOS environments.
  -Familiarity with serial interfaces (I2C, SPI, UART), oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, Git, and bug tracking systems.

Preferred

  -Previous internship or project experience with embedded firmware development.

description:

  -Strong oral, written, and interpersonal communications skills are required.

  -Proficiency with MS Word, Excel, and other standard office tools.

title: Intern - Data Scientist
description:
Summary: 
Vanguard is a client-owned investment company that offers low-cost mutual funds, ETFs, advice, and related services. The Intern - Data Scientist role involves engaging in strategic assignments and performing analytics to support data-driven business decisions, while also providing insights to influence key leadership.

Perform deep dive diagnostic, predictive, and prescriptive analytics to support data-driven business decision making.

Required

title: Machine Learning Engineering Intern
description:
Summary: 
Cambium Assessment is an education and training center, seeking a passionate and highly motivated Machine Learning Engineer Intern to join their Machine Learning Team. The intern will gain hands-on experience with transformer-based deep learning models and contribute to optimizing model performance, managing the ML model lifecycle, and supporting deployment workflows.

Responsibilities: 
Optimize inference performance for transformer-based models (e.g., quantization, pruning, batch inference).
Design and implement workflows for managing the model lifecycle (training, versioning, deployment, and monitoring).
Conduct performance benchmarking and develop tools to analyze and visualize model performance.
Collaborate with engineers and researchers to implement scalable and efficient model serving solutions.
Support integration of ML models into production pipelines using industry-standard tools and frameworks.

Qualification: 
Required
  -Currently pursuing a Master’s or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Machine Learning, or a related field.
  -Strong foundation in deep learning and hands-on experience with transformer architectures.
  -Proficiency in Python and experience with ML frameworks such as PyTorch or TensorFlow.
  -Familiarity with model optimization techniques (e.g., ONNX, TorchScript, quantization).
  -Exposure to model versioning and lifecycle tools (e.g., MLflow, SageMaker, or similar).
  -Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in a collaborative environment.
  -Experience with containerization (Docker), orchestration tools (Kubernetes), or cloud platforms (AWS/GCP/Azure).
  -Understanding of distributed training/inference strategies.

title: Co-op, Data Science
description:
Summary: 
LiveRamp is the leading data connectivity platform, aspiring to make it safe and easy for companies to use data effectively. The Co-op role in Data Science involves applying statistical and machine learning techniques to real-world problems, contributing to mission-critical projects, and working in a collaborative environment.

Responsibilities: 
Use statistical and ML based techniques to reduce selection bias, build representative samples, and analyze randomized studies in the ad-tech space.
Design and implement data models that measure ad performance across large, disparate datasets, within our data science and engineering teams,
Prototype new statistical and data modeling frameworks, translate prototypes into SQL and PySpark workflows, and then drive those prototypes into production.
Work in multiple cloud environments such as GCP, and help build, monitor, and troubleshoot automated modeling jobs using technologies such as Airflow and BigQuery.
Suggest and make improvements to internal and external models by understanding the key ingredients and underlying assumptions of the models.

Qualification: 
Required
  -Possess strong mathematics, statistics and computer science skills that you are ready to turn into industry-ready skills.
  -Background? Pursuing a degree in a Data Science related field (e.g. Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Physics or other STEM degrees).
  -Excited to learn new data science techniques and technologies.
  -Willing to dive in and learn by doing.
  -Ready to work with others to solve hard problems.
  -Possess a startup personality: smart, ethical, friendly, hard-working and proactive.
  -Excited to work with products that have close interactions with customers.

Preferred
  -Strong background in probability and statistics, experience implementing statistical models in SQL, and familiarity with fundamentals of randomized control trials.
  -Strong command of common data science toolkits (Pandas, Numpy, Matplotlib, sci-kit learn).
  -Experience writing SQL and working with relational databases.
  -Experience contributing to a mature Python-centric code base.
  -Understanding of software engineering fundamentals such as object oriented programming, computational complexity, version controlling with git, and experience in command line interfaces such as bash.
  -Experience working with large datasets
  -Experience with GCP and/or AWS cloud providers
  -Experience with Agile software development.

title: Machine Learning Intern (Infra)
description:
Summary: 
EarnIn is a pioneer in earned wage access, providing financial flexibility for individuals living paycheck to paycheck. The Machine Learning Intern will contribute to the development and maintenance of EarnIn's AI and ML platform, collaborating with engineers and gaining hands-on experience in the fintech industry.

Responsibilities: 
Contribute to developing and maintaining EarnIn’s AI and ML platform and tooling.
Collaborate with ML engineers to streamline model training, deployment, and reproducibility.
Build and onboard strong, off-the-shelf machine learning and deep learning models, making them easy for all ML teams to use.
Improve platform scalability, reliability, and cost-efficiency.
Collaborate with the machine learning teams to design, build, and maintain the ML and AI platform and tools.
Help evaluate and integrate new technologies that strengthen ML capabilities.
Gain hands-on experience with tools and infrastructure, including PyTorch, AWS, Kafka, and Databricks.

Qualification: 
Required
  -Currently pursuing or recently completed a Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
  -Solid software engineering fundamentals and understanding of ML workflows.
  -Strong programming skills in Python and experience with ML libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, XGBoost, LightGBM).
  -Familiarity with data tools like Spark, Pandas, NumPy, and SQL.
  -Strong problem-solving and collaboration skills.
  -Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.

title: Intern
description:
Summary: 
Birlasoft is a Global IT Services provider and part of the CK Birla Group. As an Intern, you will gain hands-on experience, assist in various projects, and contribute to the company's goals while receiving guidance from experienced team members.

Responsibilities: 
Assisting with the development and implementation of new software programs
Collaborating with team members to achieve project goals
Conducting research and analysis to support project objectives
Presenting findings and suggestions to the team and management

Qualification: 
Required
  -Proficiency in Python
  -Excellent communication skills
  -Ability to work in a team
  -Currently enrolled in or recently graduated from a Bachelor's or Master's degree program related to the field of the internship.

Preferred
  -Knowledge of Java or C++
  -Familiarity with data analysis tools such as Excel or Tableau
  -Experience with project management tools like Asana or Trello
  -Understanding of web development technologies like HTML, CSS, JavaScript
  -Knowledge of database management systems like SQL or MongoDB
  -Familiarity with cloud platforms like AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure
  -Experience with machine learning algorithms
  -Knowledge of statistical analysis
  -Familiarity with version control systems like Git
  -Experience with Agile or Scrum methodologies

title: Engineering Co-op - Fall
description:
Summary: 
Thermo Fisher Scientific is a biotechnology and laboratory equipment company that provides a wide range of scientific products and services. They are seeking an Engineering Co-op for the Fall, where students will be matched to projects that have significant strategic importance and will receive mentorship and leadership development opportunities.

Responsibilities: 
Partner with leadership to identify and address areas to improve efficiency and benchmark with industry best practices.
Become a process owner; critically review specific processes with great attention to detail and proactively recommend opportunities for improvement.
Use highly specialized equipment and instrumentation accurately and with limited supervision.
Develop tools and models to improve tracking and efficiency.
Learn continuous improvement methodologies (i.e., PPI, Six Sigma, and others) and help promote improvement initiatives.
Work collaboratively with other functions including program management, engineering, manufacturing, quality assurance, and finance to achieve business objectives.

Qualification: 
Required
  -Undergraduate student completing an Engineering-related degree.
  -0 years of work experience required.
  -Consistent track record of results demonstrating integrity, innovation, involvement, and intensity.
  -Energized through championing change, driven in getting results, and savvy in navigating ambiguity.
  -Excellent interpersonal communication skills with a high degree of emotional intelligence.
  -Applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States and should not require sponsorship (current or future) for employment visa status.
  -Thermo Fisher does not offer employment in this position to holders of F-1, J-1, H-1, OPT, and CPT Visas for the purpose of obtaining practical experience.

Preferred
  -Previous related internships preferred.

title: R&D Intern - Fall 2025
description:
Summary: 
ABB provides electrification and automation solutions for various industries. As an R&D Intern, you will gain practical experience through various projects while collaborating with teams to support operations and enhance your skills.

Responsibilities: 
Collaborating with various teams to support ABB’s operations, ensuring effective coordination and timely project completion within the defined timelines.
Leveraging insights about customer needs and ABB’s offerings to identify suitable solutions for clients, leading to project results that meet customer expectations.
Participating in team meetings, brainstorming sessions, and other collaborative efforts.
Seeking feedback and guidance from manager and team members to improve performance and skills.
Perform less complex engineering assignments associated with various engineering activities. Monitor progress, comply with quality, and schedule requirements, and maintain detailed logs and records.
Use computer programs to perform various engineering operations, conduct analyses and provide related data and information. Compile and assimilate data from various sources, conduct relatively routine operations and tests, prepare reports, and develop graphics for presentations.
Troubleshoot and resolve routine problems and assist in resolving more complex issues.

Qualification: 
Required
  -Currently enrolled in a bachelor's degree program in electrical or mechanical engineering, in the United States.
  -Intern must have reliable transportation to and from the worksite.
  -Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without company sponsorship now and in the future.
  -Utilize critical thinking skills to analyze complex situations and develop strategic solutions.
  -Effectively organize and prioritize tasks to meet deadlines.
  -Exhibit the capability to manage several tasks at once while maintaining high standards of quality.
  -Collaborate with team members to convey ideas, share information, and provide updates on project progress.

title: Data Scientist & AI Intern - Fall 2025
description:
Summary: 
ABB provides electrification and automation solutions for various industries, and they are seeking a Data Scientist & AI Intern for Fall 2025. In this role, you will support digital transformation initiatives and collaborate with the Business Process Management team to implement AI projects while gaining practical experience.

Responsibilities: 
Support digital transformation initiatives across multiple areas, such as Smart Factory, Industry 4.0, Manufacturing, supply chain, and finance.
Work with the Business Process Management team to implement AI projects in collaboration with senior Data Engineers and Data Scientists.
Assist in developing and deploying AI models and algorithms.
Analyze and preprocess large data sets to extract meaningful insights.
Conduct data analysis and preprocessing to back AI projects.
Contribute to the creation of AI-powered products or services.
Participate in research and development activities.

Qualification: 
Required
  -Currently enrolled in a bachelor's degree program in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field, in the United States.
  -Intern must have reliable transportation to and from the worksite.
  -Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without company sponsorship now and in the future.
  -Utilize critical thinking skills to analyze complex situations and develop strategic solutions.
  -Effectively organize and prioritize tasks to meet deadlines.
  -Exhibit the capability to manage several tasks at once while maintaining high standards of quality.
  -Collaborate with team members to convey ideas, share information, and provide updates on project progress.

title: Software Engineer Intern
description:
Summary: 
Droisys is an innovation technology company focused on helping companies accelerate their digital initiatives. They are seeking a Software Engineer Intern to contribute to their projects while gaining valuable experience in a collaborative and growth-oriented environment.

Qualification: 
Required
  -Actively pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related discipline
  -Strong programming foundation in languages such as Python, Java, C++, or equivalent
  -Solid understanding of computer science fundamentals, including algorithms and data structures
  -Hands-on experience with Git and familiarity with version control workflows
  -A passion for solving complex problems with creativity and persistence
  -Strong communication and collaboration skills; thrives in team-driven environments
  -A growth-oriented mindset, with the curiosity and drive to thrive in a fast-paced, startup atmosphere

Preferred
  -Exposure to AI and machine learning frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch
  -Experience with front-end technologies such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
